text: Sheathing type and thickness per approved submittals (gypsum/cement/OSB/plywood)
Fasteners, adhesives, joint tape, and corner reinforcement match system spec
Products stored dry, protected from moisture and impact
Wall framing checked for plumb, alignment, and stud spacing
Blocking and structural elements in place prior to sheathing
Panels cut cleanly and installed with joints centered over framing
Horizontal joints staggered between courses of panels
Fastener spacing and edge distance per spec (e.g., 8" o.c. field / 6" o.c. edge)
Fasteners flush to surface, not overdriven or protruding
Sheathing installed with required gap at panel edges (as per product)
Window and door openings accurately cut and flashed or prepared for WRB
Coordination with MEP and envelope trades to avoid rework at penetrations
Sealant, tape, or joint treatment applied per sheathing manufacturer spec
Sheathing protected from prolonged exposure prior to WRB or cladding installation
Temporary protection (e.g., tarp) installed during rain or overnight if WRB not installed yet
QA/QC review complete and documented prior to WRB install
Punch list items resolved prior to enclosing assembly
